info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:28PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Apache and Navajo Counties through 500 PM MST... At 428 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Pinetop-lakeside, or 10 miles east of Show Low, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Show Low, Pinetop-lakeside, Lake Of The Woods--Pinetop-lakeside, Wagon Wheel, Vernon, Pinetop Country Club, Scott Reservoir Campground, White Mountain Lake, Lakeside Campground, Brown Creek Campground and Los Burros Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 345 and 355. State Route 77 between mile markers 343 and 345. Highway 60 between mile markers 341 and 365. State Route 61 between mile markers 353 and 362. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
